channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 13 questions for politics in 2026
item.description: The new year is shaping up to be a consequential one, from control of power in Washington to the agenda President Trump pursues.

item.title: U.S. hit Venezuela with 'large-scale strike,' captured Nicolás Maduro, Trump says
item.description: President Trump claimed overnight that the United States carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Trump says U.S. carried out 'large-scale strike' against Venezuela
item.description: NPR's Daniel Estrin discusses the latest with NPR international correspondent Carrie Kahn.

item.title: Trump to hold a press conference on operation to remove Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro
item.description: Speaking on Fox and Friends Saturday morning, President Trump said U.S. forces sustained some injuries during the operation to remove Venezuelan Presi...

item.title: Trial to begin for police officer charged in delayed response to Uvalde school shooting
What we know about Maduro's capture
item.description: Maduro and his wife were taken from "a house that was more like a fortress", Donald Trump says.

item.title: Craig the beer-ambassador elephant dies aged 54
item.description: The peace-loving pachyderm and lager promoter was an icon of successful conservation, say officials.

item.title: Venezuela strikes continue history of U.S. interventions in Latin America
item.description: Since the Cold War, the United States has conducted over half a dozen military interventions in Latin America.

item.title: Maduro's capture comes 36 years after U.S. arrested Panama's Noriega
item.description: A one-time U.S. ally and CIA informant, Manuel Noriega​ led Panama for much of the 1980s.

item.title: More than 100 shelter overnight in Japan shrine due to heavy snow
item.description: Visitors of the Mitsumine Shrine spent the night there after roads around it were shut off.

item.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
item.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro and wife captured, flown out of country in U.S. operation, Trump says
item.description: The U.S. launched military strikes in Venezuela early Saturday morning and captured Venezuelan leader, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife Cilia, President T...

item.title: Swiss open criminal case against managers of ski resort bar after deadly fire
item.description: It comes after a preliminary investigation found the likely cause was sparklers on champagne bottles being carried too close to the ceiling.

item.title: World reaction to U.S. strikes on Venezuela pours in
item.description: Many U.S. adversaries condemned the U.S. strikes on Venezuela, while other governments called for deescalation.

item.title: Big Tech’s fast-expanding plans for data centers are running into stiff community opposition
U.S. lawmakers react after Trump announces Venezuela operation
item.description: Reactions from U.S. lawmakers poured in after the Trump administration announced strikes on Venezuela and the capture of the country's president.

item.title: Is Trump taking too much aspirin? Here's what experts say
item.description: Trump takes four times the recommended dose of aspirin for cardiac prevention. Even low-dose aspirin is no longer recommended for people over 60 who d...

item.title: Rain soaks Rose Parade in California and snow squalls hit Midwest and Northeast on first day of 2026
item.description: Rained poured down on the iconic Rose Parade for the first time in 20 years. That was as flood warnings and evacuation orders in Southern California j...
